description.narrative: A social policy programme is put in place, which contributes to Social Protection, Social Protection (Covid), Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Child victims of exclusion benefit from policies and programs based on evidence

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Delivery of cash transfers through government system (beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)

Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: A social policy programme is put in place

description.narrative:
Following cyclone Kenneth, 3,100 disaster-stricken families (12,853 children including 6,243 girls) benefited from unconditional cash transfers to meet their water, hygiene and sanitation needs and reduce their risk of water-borne diseases.
The unconditional cash transfer program in place since 2014 allowed for delivering the last tranche of funds to 559 vulnerable households (1,980 children aged less than 18, including 962 girls) in seven localities, marking the end of the project. The beneficiaries have formed small groups to develop productive activities in order to sustain the achievements of the project in terms of coverage of children's essential needs.
| Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/01/2020
